comments:
If you try to call DataObject.get() with a bogus feature name it results in a 
NullPointerException. Previous implementations threw an 
IllegalArgumentException. 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.setFeatureName
(SDOUtil.java:999)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.process
(SDOUtil.java:1099)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.<init>
(SDOUtil.java:919)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil$Accessor.create
(SDOUtil.java:905)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.get(SDOUtil.java:78)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.util.SDOUtil.getList(SDOUtil.java:168)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.sdo.impl.DynamicEDataObjectImpl.getList
(DynamicEDataObjectImpl.java:354)
The fix is available in the latest 2.0 integration driver.
